body.p: The four Board members’ concerns are heightened by the absence as yet from the Board’s main agenda of a project on accounting for exploration for and evaluation of mineral resources generally. Although a research project has begun, it is unlikely that the Board will be able to develop financial reporting standards in the medium term. Accordingly, it is likely that the concession referred to in paragraph DO2 and, in Messrs Garnett and McGregor’s cases, in paragraph DO3, will remain in place for some time.
